alert.note: Alert for Eastern Bergen; Eastern Passaic; Western Bergen; Western Essex; Western Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ESSEX, PASSAIC, NORTHWESTERN BERGEN, ROCKLAND, AND SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM... At 716 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ogdensburg to near Green Pond to Fairfield. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bloomingdale around 730 PM EDT. Paterson and Wayne around 735 PM EDT. West Milford and Pompton Lakes around 740 PM EDT. Hawthorne around 745 PM EDT. Ridgewood and Ringwood around 750 PM EDT. Monsey, Nanuet, Ramsey, Suffern, Warwick, Sloatsburg, Pearl River, Greenwood Lake and Upper Greenwood Lake around 800 PM EDT. Other locations that could be impacted by these storms include Ho-Ho- Kus, Wanaque, Park Ridge, Franklin Lakes, Cedar Grove, Totowa, Upper Saddle River, Airmont, Montebello and Oakland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
